gov.nist.secauto.swid.client.totp

Class Totp

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nist.secauto.swid.client.totp.Totp

  • public class Totp
extends Object
    A direct implementation of https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc6238.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Totp()
      Creates a default Totp instance with a 30 second time step, T0 of 0 using HMAC-SHA-1 producing an 8 digit output.
      Totp(Hotp.HashAlgorithm algorithm, int digits)
      Creates a Totp instance with a 30 second time step, T0 of 0 using the provided parameters.
      Totp(int timeStepSeconds, long T0, Hotp.HashAlgorithm algorithm, int digits)
      Creates a Totp instance with a 30 second time step, T0 of 0 using the provided parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String totp(byte[] key)
      Calculates a TOTP result using the provided key and the current time
      String totp(byte[] key, long time)
      Calculates a TOTP result using the provided key and provided time

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Totp

        public Totp()
        Creates a default Totp instance with a 30 second time step, T0 of 0 using HMAC-SHA-1 producing an 8 digit output.

      • Totp

        public Totp(Hotp.HashAlgorithm algorithm,
            int digits)
        Creates a Totp instance with a 30 second time step, T0 of 0 using the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        algorithm - the algorithm to use
        digits - the number of digits

      • Totp

        public Totp(int timeStepSeconds,
            long T0,
            Hotp.HashAlgorithm algorithm,
            int digits)
        Creates a Totp instance with a 30 second time step, T0 of 0 using the provided parameters.
        Parameters:
        timeStepSeconds - the size of the time step in seconds (this is X in the RFC)
        algorithm - the algorithm to use
        T0 - the time adjustment from UNIX time in seconds (based on UTC and the epoch)
        digits - the number of digits
        See Also:
        Hotp

    • Method Detail

      • totp

        public String totp(byte[] key)
        Calculates a TOTP result using the provided key and the current time
        Parameters:
        key - the key/seed to use for calculating the value
        Returns:
        the TOTP value for the current time point

      • totp

        public String totp(byte[] key,
                   long time)
        Calculates a TOTP result using the provided key and provided time
        Parameters:
        key - the key/seed to use for calculating the value
        time - the time value to use
        Returns:
        the TOTP value for the provided time point
